subject: Learning
title: Bandura's Social Learning Theory
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Bandura's Social Learning Theory.

hook.text: Children who watched an adult punch a Bobo doll immediately did the same. They learned aggression just by watching.

buildup.text: Albert Bandura showed that children learn behaviors by observing othersâ€”not just through direct experience.

discovery.text: Observational learning requires attention, retention, reproduction, and motivation. All four must be present.

twist.text: Children are selective observers. They imitate models who are powerful, rewarded, or similar to themselves.

climax.text: This means parents, teachers, and peers teach constantlyâ€”even when they don't intend to.

punchline.text: Children learn what they see. Be careful what you model.

quiz.question: What did Bandura's Bobo doll experiment demonstrate?
options: Children learn behaviors by observing others, not just through direct experience
Children only learn from formal instruction
Aggression is entirely genetic and cannot be learned
